evaluate a function over a sampling grid

Source: R/all_generic.R, R/hrf.R, R/regressor.R
evaluate.Rd

given an object to be evaluated and a an input sample ("grid"), evaluate the object.

evalute a regressor function over a sampling grid

evaluate(x, grid, ...)

# S3 method for HRF
evaluate(x, grid, amplitude = 1, duration = 0,
  precision = 0.2, summate = TRUE, normalize = FALSE)

# S3 method for regressor
evaluate(x, grid, precision = 0.2)

Arguments

x

the object to evaluate
grid

the sampling grid
...

extra args
amplitude

the scaling value for the event
duration

the duration of the event
precision

the temporal resolution used for computing summed responses when duration > 0
summate

whether the HRF response increases its amplitude as a function of stimulus duration.
normalize

scale output so that peak is 1.
grid

the sampling grid. A vector of real values in seconds.
precision

the sampling precision for the hrf. This parameter is passed to evaluate.HRF

Examples


hrf1 <- evaluate(HRF_SPMG1, grid=seq(0,20,by=1.5), duration=2, precision=1)

# the same, except now turn off temporal summation.
hrf2 <- evaluate(HRF_SPMG1, grid=seq(0,20,by=1.5), duration=2, precision=1,summate=FALSE)

frame <- sampling_frame(blocklens=100, TR=2)
reg <- regressor(onsets=c(10,20), hrf=HRF_SPMG1)
evaluate(reg, samples(frame))
#>   [1]  0.00000000  0.00000000  0.00000000  0.00000000  0.00000000  0.01747402
